captions.text: I just escaped from this horrible lab.
They were using me as a test subject.
Who would do such a horrible thing to you?
Hey wait! You can understand me?
Wow! I've never met anyone who communicates like I do
Just dump me in an incinerator, and forget all about me!
Has anyone ever told you that?
Hey this is none of your business, four eyes!
Come at me bro lets do this!
Say, would you like to go get something to eat?
Sure!  I know exactly what I want.
I can't understand you with your mouth full.
I said, it's a long story.
Wow! That was awesome!  Let me try!
Has anyone ever told you that?!
Yeah my last girlfriend was sort of mean, you know...
It just didn't work out between us...

comments.author: Casey5693

comments.text:
I honestly think that the debate about who has suffered more is really 
silly. They have not been through the same circumstances so you can't 
really compare the two. It is honestly like debating whether a soldier for 
a losing army or an abused child has suffered more. Chell and Gordon have 
both endured awful circumstances and have been really strong people 
throughout those awful circumstances. That's what makes them great 
characters. Chell has had to endure more emotional abuse from being 
isolated for so long and having no one to rely on but herself while Gordon 
has endured more traumatic life events in general from fighting aliens. 
They have both had shitty lives but they are both awesome. Their games are 
great, too. Can we reach an agreement?﻿

comments.text:
some paeople say that Gordon Freeman has been through alot more than Chell.

Gordon has many people to help him,all Chell had was Wheatley who then 
turned on her afterwards.

Gordon is a doctor,Chell isn't Gordon would've solved all the tests in half 
the time it took chell to do so.

Gordon is fully equipped,he has a suit that protects him from radiation and 
any other  gas or substance that can poison you yet Chell manages to kill 
GLaDOS with the threat of neurotoxin and rockets.

Even though Gordon fights aliens for a living he still has someone to spend 
time with,(his friends),Chell only has a companion cube which she has to 
incinerate and when it returns she is already released into the outside 
world where she could probably meet Gordon and the others.

Chell is an orphan and is laughed at by GLaDOS about it

(i don't know much about half life 2)﻿

comments.text:
Gordon is a theological physicist. Gordan couldn't save all he Co workers 
and watched them all die. He constantly got attacked and had to do many 
dangerous tasks because the other workers can't do shit. He was in the test 
chamber where the portal exploded. He single handedly fought off the 
military. He had so many chances to escape Black Mesa, but failed. He ended 
up going to Xen, (knowing he would problably not return) Only to kill a 
living nightmare and end up in a coma for a year years. He got beaten and 
shot at by the Combine defenceless. He destroyed their headquarters. Yeah, 
like Chelly went through more

comments.text:

mostly from PERSONS HE KNEW, being all alone in a UNKNOWN PLANET were 
EVERYONE is trying to kill you, also a place in which he had died, as 
NIhilant violently exploded, and even if he had survived the explosion, he 
had no other way to get back to earth if it was not for G-man constantly 
harassing him.

Besides he is not a trained super soldier like Duke Nukkem or Master Chief, 
he was a normal scientist forced to take weapons and fight for his life, 
and no one without proper training is mentally sane after killing and 
seeing people die.

I think Gordon has been through more both Physically and mentally
